high_level.description: Low-voltage H-bridge motor driver with PH/EN interface. Drives DC motors or other loads like solenoids. Features integrated N-channel power MOSFETs, internal charge pump, low-power sleep mode, and protection circuits (UVLO, OCP, TSD).
features: H-Bridge Motor Driver for DC Motors or Solenoids
Low MOSFET On-Resistance: HS + LS 280 mΩ typical
Low-Power Sleep Mode: 120 nA Maximum Sleep Current

VM.name: VM
VM.description: Motor power supply. Bypass this pin to GND with a 0.1 µF ceramic capacitor rated for VM. The path from VM pin to high frequency bypass capacitor and GND must be as short as possible. VM does not have UVLO protection - operation is possible down to 0V as long as VCC > 1.8V, though load cannot be sufficiently driven at low VM voltages.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to motor power supply (0V to 11V). VM and VCC can be connected together if supply voltage is between 1.8V and 7V.
implementation.bypass_capacitor: 0.1 µF ceramic capacitor to GND, placed as close to pin as possible
implementation.bulk_capacitor: Recommended for motor drive applications to handle current transients
implementation.notes: VM can be applied/removed in any order relative to VCC. When VCC is removed, device enters low-power state drawing minimal current from VM.

OUT1.name: OUT1
OUT1.description: Motor output 1. Connect to one terminal of the motor winding. Internally connected to H-bridge high-side and low-side MOSFETs.

output_current.notes: Peak drive current, internally limited by OCP

rds_on.conditions: HS + LS, VM = 5V, VCC = 3V, IO = 800 mA, TJ = 25°C

implementation.connectivity: Connect to DC motor winding terminal or solenoid. For independent half-bridge control, connect load between VM and OUT1.
implementation.layout: Keep trace to motor short to minimize inductance
implementation.notes: Output state controlled by PH and EN inputs according to truth table

OUT2.name: OUT2
OUT2.description: Motor output 2. Connect to other terminal of the motor winding. Internally connected to H-bridge high-side and low-side MOSFETs.

output_current.notes: Peak drive current, internally limited by OCP

rds_on.conditions: HS + LS, VM = 5V, VCC = 3V, IO = 800 mA, TJ = 25°C

implementation.connectivity: Connect to DC motor winding terminal or solenoid. For independent half-bridge control, connect load between VM and OUT2.
implementation.layout: Keep trace to motor short to minimize inductance
implementation.notes: Output state controlled by PH and EN inputs according to truth table

GND.name: GND
GND.description: Device ground. This pin must be connected to ground. Return for internal voltage reference and analog circuits.

implementation.layout: Use thick trace or ground plane connection. Bypass capacitors for VM and VCC should have short return path to this pin.
implementation.thermal_pad: Package thermal pad must be soldered to PCB thermal pad connected to ground for thermal and mechanical performance
implementation.notes: Critical for proper device operation and thermal dissipation

EN.name: EN
EN.description: ENABLE input for PH/EN control interface. When EN is high, H-bridge outputs are enabled and direction is controlled by PH pin. When EN is low, both outputs are driven low (brake mode). Internal pulldown resistor to ground.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to PWM signal from microcontroller for speed control, or to logic high/low for on/off control
implementation.notes: EN=0 puts H-bridge in brake mode (both outputs LOW). EN=1 enables motor drive with direction set by PH.

PH.name: PH
PH.description: PHASE input for PH/EN control interface. Controls the direction of the H-bridge output when EN is high. PH=0 drives forward (OUT1=H, OUT2=L), PH=1 drives reverse (OUT1=L, OUT2=H). Internal pulldown resistor to ground.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to microcontroller GPIO for direction control
implementation.notes: PH only affects output when EN=1. PH=0: Forward (OUT1=H, OUT2=L). PH=1: Reverse (OUT1=L, OUT2=H).

nSLEEP.name: nSLEEP
nSLEEP.description: Sleep mode input, active low. When this pin is logic low, the device enters low-power sleep mode with H-bridge outputs in Hi-Z (coast) state. Device operates normally when this pin is logic high. Internal pulldown resistor to ground.

wake_time.notes: Time from nSLEEP rising edge to part active

implementation.connectivity: Connect to microcontroller GPIO for sleep control, or tie to VCC if sleep mode not needed
implementation.notes: Internal pulldown ensures device enters sleep mode if pin is left floating. When entering sleep mode, set all inputs low to minimize system power. In sleep mode, H-bridge outputs are Hi-Z (coast mode).

VCC.name: VCC
VCC.description: Logic power supply. Powers internal logic, control circuits, and charge pump. Bypass to GND with 0.1 µF ceramic capacitor rated for VCC.

implementation.connectivity: Connect to logic supply (1.8V to 7V). VCC and VM can be connected together if supply is between 1.8V and 7V.
implementation.bypass_capacitor: 0.1 µF ceramic capacitor to GND, placed as close to pin as possible
implementation.notes: VCC and VM can be applied/removed in any order. When VCC is removed, device enters low-power state. Internal logic remains active as long as VCC > UVLO threshold.

THERMAL_PAD.name: THERMAL_PAD
THERMAL_PAD.description: Exposed thermal pad on bottom of package. Must be soldered to PCB thermal pad for proper thermal and mechanical performance.

implementation.connectivity: Solder to PCB ground plane thermal pad
implementation.thermal_vias: Use thermal vias under pad to conduct heat to inner/bottom copper layers
implementation.notes: Critical for thermal management. Junction-to-case (bottom) thermal resistance is 9.8°C/W. Junction-to-ambient thermal resistance is 60.9°C/W.

control_logic.description: DRV8838 PH/EN control interface truth table

phase_to_out1_low.description: Delay time, PHASE high to OUT1 low

phase_to_out2_high.description: Delay time, PHASE high to OUT2 high

phase_low_to_out1_high.description: Delay time, PHASE low to OUT1 high

phase_low_to_out2_low.description: Delay time, PHASE low to OUT2 low

enable_high_to_out_high.description: Delay time, ENBL high to OUTx high

enable_low_to_out_low.description: Delay time, ENBL low to OUTx low

wake_time.description: Wake time, nSLEEP rising edge to part active

uvlo.name: VCC Undervoltage Lockout
uvlo.description: If VCC falls below UVLO threshold, all H-bridge FETs are disabled. Operation resumes when VCC rises above threshold.

ocp.name: Overcurrent Protection
ocp.description: Analog current limit on each FET limits current by removing gate drive. If current limit persists longer than deglitch time, all H-bridge FETs are disabled. Detects shorts to VM, GND, or OUT1-to-OUT2.

tsd.name: Thermal Shutdown
tsd.description: If die temperature exceeds safe limits, all H-bridge FETs are disabled. Operation resumes automatically when temperature falls to safe level.
